text:
Update `README.md` to correct the Godot version.
Change the reference from "4.4.1" to "4.5.1" to match the version specified in `scripts/godot_setup.sh`.
Verify the change and report completion.
The user wants me to update README.md to change the Godot version from "4.4.1" to "4.5.1". This is a straightforward task. Let me read the README.md to find where 4.4.1 is mentioned and update it.
Found the version on line 138. Need to change "4.4.1" to "4.5.1".

{"tool":"appliedDiff","path":"README.md","isProtected":false,"diff":"<![CDATA[
<<<<<<< SEARCH
- Downloads Godot (default: 4.4.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
=======
- Downloads Godot (default: 4.5.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
>>>>>>> REPLACE
]]>","content":"@@ -135,7 +135,7 @@
 - Available at http://localhost:6333
 
 ### Godot Setup (`godot_setup.sh`)
-- Downloads Godot (default: 4.4.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
+- Downloads Godot (default: 4.5.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
 - Installs to ~/.local/bin/godot
 - Restores editor settings with VS Code integration
 - Creates desktop entry
","diffStats":{"added":1,"removed":1}}
The change was successful. Now I need to commit this change per the auto-commit rule before completing the task.
git add README.md && git commit -m "docs(readme): update Godot version from 4.4.1 to 4.5.1"

[main 1a4e6eb] docs(readme): update Godot version from 4.4.1 to 4.5.1
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)
The commit was successful. Now I can complete the task.
Updated [`README.md`](README.md:138) to change Godot version from "4.4.1" to "4.5.1" to match [`scripts/godot_setup.sh`](scripts/godot_setup.sh). Change committed as `1a4e6eb`.
